meanings.definition: A small stroke or point in writing or printing, such as the dot over the letter 'i'.
meanings.sent1: The teacher reminded the students to include tittles on top of their lowercase 'i's.
meanings.sent2: She carefully added tittles to the 'i's in her signature.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a secret message hidden in the tittles of the document.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was so sharp that she noticed the missing tittles in the text.
meanings.sent5: The tittles danced on the page, bringing life to the otherwise plain text.

meanings.definition: A tiny amount or part of something.
meanings.sent1: He only needed a few tittles of sugar to sweeten his tea.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a tittle of salt to enhance the flavor.
meanings.sent3: She felt a tittle of excitement when she saw the surprise waiting for her.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean, each fish is just a tittle in the grand scheme of marine life.
meanings.sent5: The tittle of information he shared was enough to solve the puzzle.
